# broom

## Overview

`broom` summarizes key information about models in tidy `tibble()`s.
`broom` provides three verbs to make it convenient to interact with
model objects:

- [`tidy()`](https://generics.r-lib.org/reference/tidy.html) summarizes
  information about model components
- [`glance()`](https://generics.r-lib.org/reference/glance.html) reports
  information about the entire model
- [`augment()`](https://generics.r-lib.org/reference/augment.html) adds
  informations about observations to a dataset

For a detailed introduction, please see
[`vignette("broom")`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/articles/broom.md).

`broom` tidies 100+ models from popular modelling packages and almost
all of the model objects in the `stats` package that comes with base R.
[`vignette("available-methods")`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/articles/available-methods.md)
lists method availability.

If you aren’t familiar with tidy data structures and want to know how
they can make your life easier, we highly recommend reading Hadley
Wickham’s [Tidy Data](https://www.jstatsoft.org/v59/i10).

## Installation

``` r
# we recommend installing the entire tidyverse
# modeling set, which includes broom:
install.packages("tidymodels")

# alternatively, to install just broom:
install.packages("broom")

# to get the development version from GitHub:
install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("tidymodels/broom")
```

If you find a bug, please file a minimal reproducible example in the
[issues](https://github.com/tidymodels/broom/issues).

## Usage

[`tidy()`](https://generics.r-lib.org/reference/tidy.html) produces a
`tibble()` where each row contains information about an important
component of the model. For regression models, this often corresponds to
regression coefficients. This is can be useful if you want to inspect a
model or create custom visualizations.

``` r
library(broom)

fit <- lm(Volume ~ Girth + Height, trees)
tidy(fit)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   term        estimate std.error statistic  p.value
#>   <chr>          <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 (Intercept)  -58.0       8.64      -6.71 2.75e- 7
#> 2 Girth          4.71      0.264     17.8  8.22e-17
#> 3 Height         0.339     0.130      2.61 1.45e- 2
```

[`glance()`](https://generics.r-lib.org/reference/glance.html) returns a
tibble with exactly one row of goodness of fitness measures and related
statistics. This is useful to check for model misspecification and to
compare many models.

``` r
glance(fit)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 12
#>   r.squared adj.r.squared sigma statistic  p.value    df logLik   AIC   BIC
#>       <dbl>         <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     0.948         0.944  3.88      255. 1.07e-18     2  -84.5  177.  183.
#> # ℹ 3 more variables: deviance <dbl>, df.residual <int>, nobs <int>
```

`augment` adds columns to a dataset, containing information such as
fitted values, residuals or cluster assignments. All columns added to a
dataset have `.` prefix to prevent existing columns from being
overwritten.

``` r
augment(fit, data = trees)
#> # A tibble: 31 × 9
#>    Girth Height Volume .fitted .resid   .hat .sigma   .cooksd .std.resid
#>    <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>
#>  1   8.3     70   10.3    4.84  5.46  0.116    3.79 0.0978        1.50  
#>  2   8.6     65   10.3    4.55  5.75  0.147    3.77 0.148         1.60  
#>  3   8.8     63   10.2    4.82  5.38  0.177    3.78 0.167         1.53  
#>  4  10.5     72   16.4   15.9   0.526 0.0592   3.95 0.000409      0.140 
#>  5  10.7     81   18.8   19.9  -1.07  0.121    3.95 0.00394      -0.294 
#>  6  10.8     83   19.7   21.0  -1.32  0.156    3.94 0.00840      -0.370 
#>  7  11       66   15.6   16.2  -0.593 0.115    3.95 0.00114      -0.162 
#>  8  11       75   18.2   19.2  -1.05  0.0515   3.95 0.00138      -0.277 
#>  9  11.1     80   22.6   21.4   1.19  0.0920   3.95 0.00348       0.321 
#> 10  11.2     75   19.9   20.2  -0.288 0.0480   3.95 0.0000968    -0.0759
#> # ℹ 21 more rows
```

### Contributing

We welcome contributions of all types!

For questions and discussions about tidymodels packages, modeling, and
machine learning, please [post on Posit
Community](https://forum.posit.co/new-topic?category_id=15https://rstd.io/tidymodels-communitytags=tidymodels,question).
If you think you have encountered a bug, please [submit an
issue](https://github.com/tidymodels/broom/issues). Either way, learn
how to create and share a
[reprex](https://reprex.tidyverse.org/articles/articles/learn-reprex.html)
(a minimal, reproducible example), to clearly communicate about your
code. Check out further details on [contributing guidelines for
tidymodels packages](https://www.tidymodels.org/contribute/) and [how to
get help](https://www.tidymodels.org/help/).

If you have never directly contributed to an R package before, `broom`
is an excellent place to start. Find an
[issue](https://github.com/tidymodels/broom/issues/) with the **Beginner
Friendly** tag and comment that you’d like to take it on and we’ll help
you get started.

Generally, too, we encourage typo corrections, bug reports, bug fixes
and feature requests. Feedback on the clarity of the documentation is
especially valuable!

If you are interested in adding tidier methods for new model objects,
please read [this
article](https://www.tidymodels.org/learn/develop/broom/) on the
tidymodels website.

We have a [Contributor Code of
Conduct](https://github.com/tidymodels/broom/blob/main/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
By participating in `broom` you agree to abide by its terms.

# Package index

## Tidying generics

- [`reexports`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/reexports.md)
  [`augment`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/reexports.md)
  [`tidy`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/reexports.md)
  [`glance`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/reexports.md) :
  Objects exported from other packages

## Tidiers

- [`tidy(`*`<data.frame>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/data.frame_tidiers.md)
  [`augment(`*`<data.frame>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/data.frame_tidiers.md)
  [`glance(`*`<data.frame>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/data.frame_tidiers.md)
  : Tidiers for data.frame objects
- [`tidy(`*`<durbinWatsonTest>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/durbinWatsonTest_tidiers.md)
  [`glance(`*`<durbinWatsonTest>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/durbinWatsonTest_tidiers.md)
  : Tidy/glance a(n) durbinWatsonTest object
- [`tidy(`*`<leveneTest>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/leveneTest_tidiers.md)
  : Tidy/glance a(n) leveneTest object
- [`tidy(`*`<list>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/list_tidiers.md)
  [`glance(`*`<list>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/list_tidiers.md)
  : Tidying methods for lists / returned values that are not S3 objects
- [`tidy(`*`<rma>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/metafor_tidiers.md)
  : Tidy a(n) rma object
- [`tidy(`*`<NULL>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/null_tidiers.md)
  [`glance(`*`<NULL>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/null_tidiers.md)
  [`augment(`*`<NULL>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/null_tidiers.md)
  : Tidiers for NULL inputs
- [`tidy(`*`<SpatialPolygonsDataFrame>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/sp_tidiers.md)
  [`tidy(`*`<SpatialPolygons>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/sp_tidiers.md)
  [`tidy(`*`<Polygons>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/sp_tidiers.md)

  [`tidy(`*`<SpatialLinesDataFrame>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/sp_tidiers.md)
  [`tidy(`*`<Lines>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/sp_tidiers.md)
  [`tidy(`*`<Line>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/sp_tidiers.md)
  : Tidy a(n) SpatialPolygonsDataFrame object
- [`tidy(`*`<summaryDefault>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/summary_tidiers.md)
  [`glance(`*`<summaryDefault>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/summary_tidiers.md)
  : (Deprecated) Tidy summaryDefault objects
- [`tidy(`*`<Arima>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/tidy.Arima.md)
  : Tidy a(n) Arima object

  : Tidy a(n) regsubsets object
- [`tidy(`*`<ridgelm>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/tidy.ridgelm.md)
  : Tidy a(n) ridgelm object
- [`tidy(`*`<rlm>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/tidy.rlm.md)
  : Tidy a(n) rlm object
- [`tidy(`*`<glmrob>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/tidy.robustbase.glmrob.md)
  : Tidy a(n) glmrob object
- [`tidy(`*`<lmrob>`*`)`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/tidy.robustbase.lmrob.md)
  : Tidy a(n) lmrob object

  : Tidy a(n) roc object

  : Add fitted values, residuals, and other common outputs to an augment
  call

## Miscellaneous

- [`broom-package`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/broom.md)
  [`broom`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/broom.md) :
  broom: Convert Statistical Objects into Tidy Tibbles
- [`bootstrap()`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/bootstrap.md)
  : Set up bootstrap replicates of a dplyr operation
- [`confint_tidy()`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/confint_tidy.md)
  : (Deprecated) Calculate confidence interval as a tidy data frame
- [`finish_glance()`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/finish_glance.md)
  : (Deprecated) Add logLik, AIC, BIC, and other common measurements to
  a glance of a prediction
- [`fix_data_frame()`](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/reference/fix_data_frame.md)
  : Ensure an object is a data frame, with rownames moved into a column

  methods](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/articles/available-methods.md):

  dplyr](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/articles/broom_and_dplyr.md):

  broom](https://broom.tidymodels.org/dev/articles/kmeans.md):
